history.content:
The workload (projects and exams) will probably be exactly the same as on the current website, https://cs184.eecs.berkeley.edu/sp19. I took the class with about the same level of experience as you and found it challenging but doable and very rewarding! I am sometimes a slow programmer and the class mostly revolves around programming projects, so that was the main time sink for me.

I would not consider myself to have a particularly strong mathematical background, and I felt pretty capable of learning things throughout the course -- I think when you're in the class, for any given topic it's fairly clear which math concepts you need and you can just refresh yourself as needed. Even now, I still need to do this :) 

Here's a list of compiled math resources for the course https://cs184.eecs.berkeley.edu/sp19/article/9/math-resources, currently only covering linear algebra, but hopefully there will be more in the future!

Other classes: 194-26 (Computational Photography/Image processing), 160 (User Interfaces), 280 (Computer Vision), 284B (Adv Computer Graphics), 294-137 (Virtual Reality), EE/EECS 225B (Digital Image Processing), some other 3D reconstruction/recognition classes but I don't know the numbers or how often they're offered

As your interests develop, you may find classes in machine learning, systems programming, etc. relevant :)

children.subject: OP here: Thanks so much for the detailed response--super helpful! I'm excited to take the course!

history.content: I'm thinking of taking 184 next semester as my only CS course, as I know it's a pretty heavy workload. I was wondering whether I need to brush up or learn more math/linear algebra/calculus before taking the course. For reference, I will have taken 61A,B,C, EE16A, CS 70, 170 before then. I was wondering whether I should review math topics before then, can anyone who took the class provide input? What is the class like in general (workload, projects, enjoyment)? Also, if anyone is interested in visual computing, graphics, virtual reality, etc., what are some good courses to take after 184 for potential graphics/interdisciplinary visual research? (Not necessarily interested in animation per se, but VR, graphics, imaging, etc.)
history.subject: Preparation for 184, math prerequisites, related courses
